comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: English suffragettes--officers in the WSPU--Beatrice Helen Saunders was the financial secretary in the London office, and Harriet Roberta Kerr (1859-1940) was the Secretary.  They were arrested together under the "Cat and Mouse Act" in Fall of 1913.

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information (and correct spelling of Harriet Kerr's name!).  It's helpful to know what likely made the photo newsworthy for the Bain News Service.  We'll adjust the description when we update the record.
